description.narrative: The project aims at increasing the capacity of FCA’s southern partner organisations and FCA’s regional offices through the work of skilled volunteers, and to give operational programme support through expert volunteer deployment. a) Increasing the cap acities of FCA’s local partners and regional office according to the needs in the field. The expert volunteers will focus on capacity building activities, support and training of local staff and local communities. The project contributes to enhancing the quality of FCA’s deployment capacity in different thematic fields and on programme level.b) Strengthening thematic expertise globally and in FinlandThe volunteers will have the opportunity to engage in the selected partner organisations’ work in devel oping countries and to gain relevant work experience and knowledge, allowing the volunteers to deepen the impact of their work. The programme contributes to building capacity of experts in different thematic sectors, serving FCA’s volunteer networks and the roster of experts.In 2016, the thematic focus will be in livelihood, with long- and short-time deployments, partly in coordination with the Women’s Bank network. • In Uganda, a long-term agribusiness specialist is needed. • In several Women’s B ank projects, there is need for short-time skills donation visits by the network’s volunteers, providing technical and funding support.Expected results:Increased capacities of local partners in right to livelihood work. Enhanced quality of FCA’s deploy ment capacity in thematic work and on programme level. Strengthened expertise globally and in Finland by deepening the knowledge of volunteers.Right- holders /beneficiaries: Staff working in with FCA’s projects, farmers and female entrepreneursImplementi ng partners:FCA regional/country offices and their local partners
